description:
Conquered by alternate-world invaders, Japan has become a shadow of what it once was. Manga, anime, idols, and more are censored by these parallel universe overlords...or so it seems. In the less-than-legal stores of Akihabara, Hosomichi joins a group of female freedom fighters made up of pilots and otakus.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: สาวน้อยวัยใส พิชิตชัยในโลกเผด็จการ

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

node.description:
__Associated Names:__ Poyoyon Rock (ぽよよんろっく), Poyoyon♥Rock (ぽよよん♥ろっく), Pucchin Purin

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/punipoyo)

A Japanese animator, character designer, and animation director currently living in Tokyo, Japan. He often goes by the pseudonym Poyoyon Rock.  He is also a member of the doujinshi circle Pokopii.  

(Source: Wikipedia)
Members: Waka Kirishima (霧島若歌), Fuuri Uebana (上花楓裏), Risuko Sasakama (ささかまリス子)

**Height:** 147 cm
**Hobbies:** Singing, drawing, watching anime

[Website](https://suzukiaina.jp/) | [Profile (IAM Agency)](http://iamagency.sukurepo.jp/actors/women/suzuki_aina) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aina_suzuki723) | [Agency Twitter](https://twitter.com/AinaSuzuki_Info) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpNypDVlaMyJDx7P8u3dd-A)

She debuted as a voice actress in 2014. She is also skilled in the Minyou (民謡) genre, which is a genre of traditional Japanese music, where she won many competitions.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Sakawa - Azur Lane (VG)

__[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/sira10/)__

__Birthplace:__ Toride City, Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

__Yuusuke Shirato__ is a Japanese arranger, composer, lyricist and musician.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.
Roque Nicolás Frías Caed is an Argentine voice actor based in Mexico. He is best known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Silco in _Arcane_

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/fabioreallyfast/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/FabioCamposDub) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/fabio.campos.3511)

Fábio Campos is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director and musician.

As dubbing director, he has worked at DuBrasil since 2014, and is also a professor in the studio's dubbing course. He also works as a musician, being a bassist in the group Speed ​​Bullets Trio.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Takeda Takahashi (Mortal Kombat X)
- José Manuel Esquivel "Chema" (Grachi)
- Marlon (The Walking Dead: The Final Season)
- Saber (Mobile Legends: Bang Bang)
- Agent Ned Ross (NCIS: Hawai'i)
- Peter Porker / Spider-Ham and Two-Gun Kid (LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2)
- El Chavo del Ocho (El Chavo video game)
- Joshua "Josh" Wilson / White Josh (Crazy Ex-Girlfriend)
!~

**Residency:** Nerima, Tokyo, Japan
**Graduated:** Meiji University

**[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tr.netamemo)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/netamemo)**

**Yoshie Terushige** is a Japanese producer who works for the company Lantis.

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - #01: I'd Like to Turn the Tables With You (If Possible)!
Episode 2 - #02: I Want to Believe in You (Somehow)!
Episode 3 - #03: See That? A (Surprisingly) Stunning Comeback!
Episode 4 - #04: No Matter What, I'll be an Idol (The Last in Japan)!
Episode 5 - #05: I Mean, I'm an Idol (No Matter What Anyone Says)!
Episode 6 - #06: The Akiba Apocalypse Revelation (That No One Asked For)!
Episode 7 - #07: (Come out!) The Best Way to Live as a Shut-In!
Episode 8 - #08: (Welcome!) The Best Way to Live as a Shut-In!
Episode 10 - #10: Look at That! Turning the Tables (of Treachery)!
Episode 11 - #11: I Want to Believe in You (This Time)!
Episode 12 - #12: I Want to Turn the Tide With You (And Everyone Else)!
